mplviz package¶

Module contents¶

A fluent, chainable wrapper around Matplotlib for creating and managing plots. Designed for clean, expressive, and reusable plotting in Python.

Author: BBEK-Anand License: MIT

Bases: object

aspect(value='auto')¶

Sets the aspect ratio of the plot.

Parameters: value : str or float, optional, default=’auto’

The aspect ratio to set: - ‘auto’ (default): automatic aspect ratio based on the data - ‘equal’: equal scaling on both axes - float: fixed aspect ratio, e.g., 1.0 for equal scaling - ‘scaled’: scaled based on the data range

Returns: self : Viz

The Viz object itself, allowing for method chaining.

static combine_viz(viz_list, nrows=None, ncols=None)¶

Combines multiple Viz objects into a single figure with subplots.

Parameters: viz_list : list

A list of Viz objects to combine.

nrowsint, optional

The number of rows for the subplot grid (default is None).

ncolsint, optional

The number of columns for the subplot grid (default is None).

Returns: Viz

A new Viz object containing the combined plots.

Additional keyword arguments passed to fig.tight_layout(), such as: - pad : float, optional (padding between plot elements) - h_pad : float, optional (height padding) - w_pad : float, optional (width padding) - rect : tuple, optional (the area to which the layout is confined, e.g., (left, bottom, right, top))
